intro: Cissampelos tamoides, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by small, round fruits. Its roots and stems contain alkaloids and have been used in traditional medicine for various purposes. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
